name: FindMatchingBankTransactions
description:
Find matching uncategorized bank transactions.

This tool retrieves a list of uncategorized bank transactions that match specified criteria. It can also handle invoices, bills, and credit notes by recording and matching new payment or refund transactions.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: ID of the organization to search transactions for.

value_schema.description: ID of the organization

parameters.name: transaction_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the bank transaction to search for matching entries.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier of the bank transaction.

parameters.name: bank_transaction_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the bank transaction to be matched.

value_schema.description: Unique identifier of the bank transaction.

parameters.name: transaction_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of transaction. Allowed values: deposit, refund, transfer_fund, card_payment, sales_without_invoices, expense_refund, owner_contribution, interest_income, other_income, owner_drawings, sales_return. Note: Some types are module-specific and cannot be created under this endpoint.

value_schema.description:
Type of the transaction.
Allowed transaction types : deposit, refund(*Supported only in Credit Card accounts), transfer_fund, card_payment, sales_without_invoices, expense_refund, owner_contribution, interest_income, other_income, owner_drawings, sales_return
Note: You will not be able to create the following module-specific transaction types under Bank Transaction endpoints :
Expense, Vendor Advance/Vendor Payment/Bill Payment, Vendor Credit Refund, Vendor Payment Refund, Customer Advance/Customer Payment, Credit Note Refund, Payment Refund. Hence, refer them in their repective modules.

parameters.name: filter_date_after
parameters.description: Specify the date after which transactions should be filtered. Use YYYY-MM-DD format.

value_schema.description: Date after which Transactions are to be filtered

parameters.name: filter_date_before
parameters.description: Specify a date in YYYY-MM-DD format. Transactions before this date will be filtered.

value_schema.description: Date before which Transactions are to be filtered

parameters.name: minimum_transaction_amount
parameters.description: Minimum amount to filter transactions. Only transactions equal to or greater than this amount are included.

value_schema.description: Starting amout with which transactions are to be filtered

parameters.name: maximum_transaction_amount
parameters.description: Maximum amount for filtering transactions. Only transactions with an amount less than or equal to this value will be included.

value_schema.description: Starting amout with which transactions are to be filtered

parameters.name: transaction_contact_name
parameters.description: Name of the contact person involved in the transaction.

value_schema.description: Contact person name, involved in the transaction.

parameters.name: transaction_reference_number
parameters.description: Reference number of the transaction to filter matching records.

value_schema.description: Reference Number of the transaction

parameters.name: page_number_to_fetch
parameters.description: Page number to fetch. Default is 1, used for pagination.

value_schema.description: Page number to be fetched. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: records_per_page
parameters.description: Number of records to be fetched per page. The default value is 200.

value_schema.description: Number of records to be fetched per page. Default value is 200.

parameters.name: show_all_transactions
parameters.description: Set to true to display all transactions without applying filters; false to filter transactions.

value_schema.description: Check if all transactions must be shown
